item.title: Rolls-Royce Details Profit, Cost-Saving Targets
item.description: Rolls-Royce said it expected to deliver £400-500 million in cost savings in the mid-term, paving the way to restore capital returns, as it set out its financial targets through 2027.

item.title: EasyJet Resumes Dividend After Strong Annual Results
item.description: EasyJet posted an above-forecast headline profit for fiscal 2023 on improved revenue, and announced its first dividend payout since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Novartis Ups Mid-Term Targets
item.description: Novartis said it aims for annual sales growth of 5% through 2027 after what it called a progress in delivering its pure-play strategy.

item.title: German Bund Yields Ease, Await Decline in Inflation Data on Wednesday
item.description: German Bunds are in “joyful anticipation” of lower German inflation numbers that look in store on Wednesday, Commerzbank Research said, adding the 10-year Bund yields look set to test 2.5%.

item.title: German Consumer Confidence Ticks Up Slightly
item.description: Germany’s forward-looking consumer-sentiment index forecast confidence to improve in December, helped by easing inflation, although the overall reading remains at a low level, and there are no signs of a sustainable recovery in the coming months.

item.title: President Biden won't attend a United Nations climate summit being held in Dubai this week.
item.description: President Biden won’t attend a United Nations climate summit being held in Dubai this week.

item.title: The man arrested in connection with the shooting of three young men of Palestinian descent in Burlington, Vt., was charged with attempted murder.
item.description: The man arrested in connection with the shooting of three young men of Palestinian descent in Burlington, Vt., was charged with attempted murder.

item.title: Israel and Hamas agreed to a two-day extension of their truce in Gaza to allow for the release of more Israeli hostages as part of a fragile agreement that has brought respite from seven weeks of war.
item.description: Israel and Hamas agreed to a two-day extension of their truce in Gaza to allow for the release of more Israeli hostages as part of a fragile agreement that has brought respite from seven weeks of war.

item.title: Elon Musk said that those "intent on murder must be neutralized" after touring an Israeli kibbutz that was attacked by Hamas on Oct. 7.
item.description: Elon Musk said that those “intent on murder must be neutralized” after touring an Israeli kibbutz that was attacked by Hamas on Oct. 7.

item.title: The cease-fire has allowed a surge of aid to reach Palestinians in Gaza, but humanitarian groups and civilians in the enclave say the convoys aren't nearly enough to address the needs of the strip's two million people.
item.description: The cease-fire has allowed a surge of aid to reach Palestinians in Gaza, but humanitarian groups and civilians in the enclave say the convoys aren’t nearly enough to address the needs of the strip’s two million people.

item.title: Moscow holds the advantage on the military, political and economic fronts as Russia's war against Ukraine approaches its third year.
item.description: Moscow holds the advantage on the military, political and economic fronts as Russia’s war against Ukraine approaches its third year.

item.title: Russian Court Extends Detention of WSJ Reporter
item.description: The ruling lengthens Evan Gershkovich’s detention through at least Jan. 30, by which time he will have been in custody for 10 months.

item.title: PBOC Governor Calls for New Growth Drivers to Transform China's Economy
item.description: China’s central bank governor highlighted the need to nurture new growth drivers, warning against continuing to rely on infrastructure and real-estate sectors.

item.title: PSG Equity Backs Emissions-Gauging Software Maker One Click
item.description: The company’s programs help manufacturers and construction companies measure their carbon footprints.

item.title: U.K. Shop-Price Inflation Slows Further
item.description: Prices at U.K. stores in the first week of November were 4.3% higher on year, lower than October’s 5.2% rise and below the three-month average rate, helped by lower food and energy costs and competition among retailers ahead of Christmas.

item.title: Nikkei Edges Lower on Yen Strength, Likely Position Adjustment
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average edged lower amid yen strength, which hurts exporters’ overseas earnings when repatriated to Japan.

item.title: USD May Stay Supported on Econ Growth, Yield Advantages
item.description: The dollar was expected to remain supported against other major developed market currencies in the coming months, Lombard Odier said.

item.title: Gaza Is Falling Into 'Absolute Chaos,' Aid Groups Say
item.description: Humanitarian groups and civilians say the aid convoys that entered during the cease-fire aren’t nearly enough to address the needs of the strip’s two million people.

item.title: The Cost of Doing Business With China? A $40,000 Dinner With Xi Jinping Might Be Just the Start
item.description: Beijing’s green lights for Broadcom and Mastercard are seen as isolated successes tied to politics.

item.title: The Clearest Sign of India's Very Good Year
item.description: Currencies around the world have weakened against the dollar, but the rupee has held strong, as virtually everything has gone right for India.
